body:
Thanks @parndt for your contribution. There are two main concerns here:

1) `empty?` is not exactly the same as `any?`. `any?` actually iterates over each element of the block and can be considerably slower in these situations. This has already bitten us and for this reason we do not recommend replacing `empty?` by `any?` in Rails code base. I am aware that this example wouldn't expose problems but we avoid doing it regardless because we don't such to become an idiom in Rails;

2) What Koz tried to say is that we have over 200 pull requests and in general I agree with him that we should avoid sending aesthetic changes to Rails. I agree aesthetics are also important but considering all the work there is to be done, they have low priority. Reviewing a pull request, for smallish that it looks like, takes some time and we have limited resources.

I hope you understand our concerns and that it doesn't stop you from contributing to Rails as you did many times before.
